case_title: MUSTAFA KAMAL vs GHULAM SABIR, ADVOCATE DISTRICT BAR ASSOCIATION, PESHAWAR

accussed_details.name: Ghulam Sabir
allegation: Violation of canons of conduct for Advocates
Dishonest withdrawal of legal notice without client instructions

complaint_summary: Mustafa Kamal alleged that Ghulam Sabir, his engaged Advocate, dishonestly withdrew a legal notice sent to the State Life Insurance Corporation of Pakistan without his instructions, violating professional ethics and betraying client trust.
investigation_summary: The Disciplinary Committee of the N.W.F.P. Bar Council initiated proceedings on 2001-05-19, during which Ghulam Sabir admitted issuing and withdrawing the notice but claimed actions were done on behalf of Abdul Waheed Khan Advocate. Evidence revealed that the respondent acted without client instructions and withdrew the notice with ulterior motives. The matter was referred to the Tribunal for final adjudication.
judgment_summary: The Tribunal found Ghulam Sabir guilty of professional misconduct for withdrawing a legal notice without client instructions. He was suspended from the legal profession for two years and ordered to pay Rs.48,840 to the complainant and Rs.5,000 as costs of proceedings, with a payment deadline of 30 days. Recovery was to be executed by the District and Sessions Judge, Peshawar under Section 44(3)(b) of the Legal Practitioner and Bar Councils Act, 1973.
punishment: Suspension from legal profession for two years; payment of Rs.48,840 to complainant and Rs.5,000 as costs within 30 days.
Decision_or_verdict: Guilty of professional misconduct; suspension and monetary penalties imposed.
legal_arguments: Prosecution argued that withdrawal of notice without client instructions constituted misconduct.
Defense claimed actions were performed in good faith for Abdul Waheed Khan Advocate and denied client relationship.
Tribunal rejected defense arguments due to lack of evidence supporting claims.
